Let's start off with the basics. This game is old. The sooner you accept the fact that its a clunk game from the late 90s, the sooner you'll love it. This was my first playthrough, so there was no nostalgia factor. Overall, it was fantastic storywise. Other than minor hiccups with the hammer engine and its physics, the game ran really well. A must play to understand where the first person genre was built from.

This is a classic FPS game. Granted it's not the first First-Person Shooter the world has seen, that title goes to Maze 3D or Wolfenstein 3D, but this game perfected the genre and gave birth to modern FPS games we come to know today. Granted the game hasn't aged well graphically but it's still fun to play, even on today's standards. Would definitely recommend, just make sure to disable the HD models when playing this in order to have an authentic experience.

This is the best game I have ever played, bar none. I tried it out at my buddy's house back a few months ago and was immediately hooked. Just got a PC a week ago and you can be damn well sure this was one of the first things I bought.

I love everything about Half Life, up to and including On A Rail (even if it took me 3 hours to beat that part). The enemy variety is astounding for how old this is, and the AI is still impressive even today. Some aspects of Half Life certainly haven't aged well, although most of it boils down to simple graphical infidelity which is easily overlooked. Even still some of the weirder textures still had a unique charm to em. 

If you haven't played Half Life yet, please do yourself a favor and get it. Don't do your first playthrough on hard like i did, though. Hard mode is absolute hell sometimes.
i busted at least 3 1/2 times playing this game its that good

Half Live is the game that people will still be talking about long into the future. It's so beloved, that a group of developers created Black Mesa for free in their spare time. The story is second to none and fans of the franchise is still waiting for HL3. The episodes and Alyx does not quite scratch that itch.

[b]Half-Life[/b] es...

Un clásico. Un hito histórico. Una huella en la cultura. Un antes y un después. Uno de esos juegos que doy las gracias de haber podido jugarlo en su época. Una revolución. Un propulsor de la industria. Una referencia y hasta la vara con qué medir. 
Y no estoy exagerando: [b]"Half-Life"[/b] fue el puntapié inicial de una saga (y de empresas como [b]Valve[/b] y [b]Steam[/b]) que todo aquel que se quiera llamar [i]gamer[/i] debería conocer. Aunque podríamos exceptuar tal vez a los más jóvenes que no llegaron a conocerlo en su momento, pues hoy no sé si lo recomendaría: es una [u]pieza de museo[/u] mas que un juego decente. Por eso, si acaso vas a jugarlo por primera vez, hacelo con cuidado de no romperlo: sus gráficos han quedado ya tan viejos que parecen resquebrajarse, y sus otrora innovadoras ideas en jugabilidad, narración, guión, e inteligencia artificial... son hoy algo de lo más común (¡y adivinen gracias a quién!).

[b]Half-Life"[/b] será por siempre uno de esos juegos de juegoteca. Como [b]Doom[/b]... sólo que mejor.
经典永远是经典，无需过多评价

A First Person shooter classic. Set in the Black Mesa Research Complex, the game provides a very exciting setting for a shooting game. The level / environment design is the game's strongest suit since most of the levels have a high degree of internal believability and feature a lot of interconnectivity. The game also makes use of very varied combat environments filled with combat setpieces and puzzles so you're rarely stuck doing just one thing. The audiovisual design still feels like it holds up with great action soundtrack used at exciting setpieces, weapons and the industrial machinery sounding what one would expect. My main criticism of the game was that some enemies feel VERY bullet-spongy meaning that even if you surprise them you're going to take a lot of damage which is fair enough. The conclusion of the game was in my opinion far weakest part of the game in terms of combat, aesthetics and especially the final combat encounter didn't function very well. Still, very enjoyable game and a worthwhile experience.

Half-Life is one of the most timeless 90's PC games, at least gameplay-wise.
The game follows the adventures of Gordon Freeman, a 27 year old therotical physicist who works at a mysterious scientific research facility called "Black Mesa", located deep within New Mexico's rocky underground areas. The game starts with a monorail ride that gives the player a look at the ambience. The soundtrack that plays during said ride gives chills up the spine and feeling of dread to any first-timer. After finishing the sequence, the player arrives at Sector C, where they have to start rushing toward the testing chamber, not before getting a Mark IV HEV Suit to put on as a security measure.

I won't spoil much of the rest, and I don't want to make the review a 20 page long explanation of the lore, so I'll get to the technical and gameplay side of the game. First off, you may have noticed the visuals are a bit rough. This is usually something most players can get over quickly, as with any other old-school 3D first-person shooter. 

However, if you really think the graphics are affecting your experience, but you're still eager to play it, you may also try Half-Life: Source, an official Valve port of the game to Half-Life 2's signature engine, Source, or you could also play Black Mesa, a full-on remake of the original game on a brand-new engine that not only massively improves its outdated visuals, but also has some gameplay changes and expansion of certain chapters and maps. 

Anyway, getting back on topic, Half Life seriously made the entire gaming industry rethink the purpose and possibilities of a story-driven FPS title. After all, shooters back then were thought to be short, fun and chaotic experiences, like Wolfenstein and DOOM. Half Life however, while still keeping gunplay a priority, gave space for a story and plot. Story-driven games did exist, but they were usually RPGs that required really long dialogs and walls of text to explain the lore, and included primitive (or none) gunplay, like the first Fallout for example. Half Life however, needed no more than a few hundred voicelines and implicit story telling to deliver a plot, which is quite the achievement event to this day, where first-person shooters still struggle to deliver stories in a meaningful and interesting way.

In short, great game, and the first shooter I ever played that got me hooked on its lore. 10/10 would beat zombies to death with a crowbar again
super sie robin bhopa

Half-Life is an FPS with survival-horror elements that was released in 1998. It revolutionized the world of not just FPS's but gaming as a whole. It was an immersive experience like no other and has set a lot of trends in how games tell their stories that are still commonly used today but just because a game revolutionized gaming doesn't mean it hold up today. However, Half-Life doesn't just hold up but remains one of the best games of all time and is my tied favorite game of all time. 

Half-Life has a somewhat cliche story however the story manages to stay interesting due to the way the story is told. You never leave Gordon Freeman's perspective throughout the entire game and you remain in control for the majority of the experience with only 1 exception I can think of. Set-pieces are commonly used to great effect and help tell the story in a natural way.

Where Half-Life shines is in it's fast-paced but methodical game-play. There are 2 main types of enemy. There are aliens which appear in a select few chapters throughout the game. They are pretty interesting as there are a lot of variants and they are all unique. They provide a nice survival-horror theme earlier in the game but ultimately leave a little to be desired. The second variant of enemy are the soldiers. Soldiers are my favorite aspect of this game. A lot of people complain that their weapons are hit-scan and that it can feel unfair while others complain that firefights can turn into you and the enemy just unloading your rounds into each other. I disagree with both of these critiques and believe that this was intentional by the developers to create more strategical game-play. Soldiers can not shoot and run at the same time so a lot of the game revolves around you trying to outsmart the enemy. Remember, you're a theoretical physicist not a doom-guy. Each weapon has a unique purpose and there are a lot of weapons in the game. Throwing grenades make enemies run away giving you a chance to unload into their back-side. You can shoot explosive barrels and move wooden boxed to make cover. Little tactics like these add up into a strategical, fast-paced, run and gun experience. 

10 euro is not a lot of money and I have played this game 4 times (currently on my 5th play-through) and have sunk 50 hours into this masterpiece so far so you can probably imagine that I highly recommend you pick up this game. But before that I suggest you watch a video titled "Why Half-life 1 is so unforgiving" made by 'Leadhead' on Youtube. They do a fantastic job of outlining how Half-Life 1 should be played for the best experience. All I have left to say is I hope you have as much fun as I have and will for hours on end.

I've got so many great memories with this game. I think I'm gonna be playing this for a long time to come. Crossfire feels like home.

I know I'm late to this, but i just realized I never left a review for this game. First of all, it's impossible to play... the difficulty spikes and when you get stuck in an auto save with only 3 health it becomes nearly impossible, but HOLY CRAP! this game was released in 1998, and I've played a ton of games in that era, they don't even come close, for all its flaws this game set the groundwork for what first person shooters are and even what they should be.
You definitely need to play this and even its counterparts just for the history lesson in game development, though you might want to turn on god mode...

Купил эту игру на распродаже, поиграв в Quake и Quake 2. Поначалу я не понимал движ вокруг Half-life. Но после того, как я купил её, я понял, что эта игра - шедевр. Эта игра впечаталась в разуме поколения навсегда, и это не просто так! Но обо всём по порядку.

Многие жалуются на излишнюю затянутость игры. Отчасти соглашусь, но в этом и весь шарм и атмосфера тех лет, когда тебя, вместо того, чтобы бросить в мочилово, кормят с ложечки сюжетом и эпиком [spoiler] (Каскадный резонанс) [/spoiler]. Экшн тут тоже присутствует, в виде мест, наполненных турелями, солдатами, вортигонтами и прочей швалью. Однако, эти места не становятся муторными. Их можно пройти по-разному: пойти в раш с дробовиком, тихо кинуть гранату, перестрелять всех со снайперского арбалета, выпустить жуков... И ещё много всего другого! Короче, игра стоит своих денег, это определённо. Купить более чем советую!

Now if you have the choice between Black Mesa and Half-Life definitely choose Black Mesa as it is a more modern remastered version of this game that fixes most the bugs. Half-Life isn't a bad game by any means  and is still a great game to this day however in my opinion it hasn't aged that well with it's slippery physics, enemy placement, damage dealt vs damage received, bland soundtrack, etc. I will say that if you want to check out some gaming history this is a great game to play but if you just want to have great time while playing the first chapter of Gordon Freeman's adventure then I would heavily advise choosing Black Mesa.

Half-Life nasıl desem, artık bir genel kültür öğesine gelmiş bir oyun. Oyuncuların mutlaka oynaması ya da en azından bilmesi gereken bir oyun. Valve'ın en iyi oyunu. Gerçi sadece Valve'ın da değil çıktığı dönemde en iyi oyundu Half-Life. Hikayesi güzel görüntü kalitesi güzel hele hele multiplayer kısmı internet kafelerin vazgeçilmeziydi. Kendi çocukluğumdan hatırlıyorum da bizim internet kafede yer olmazdı sırf herkes oynayabilsin diye herkes en fazla 1 saat aralıksız oturabilirdi. Bir masa boşalınca kimin sırasıysa hemen o masaya geçer oyuna kaldığı yerden devam ederdi. Bomba kurmak, lazer veya süpürge... Bunların anlamları bizim için ayrı bir yer taşır. O dönemde olmayan şimdiki çocuklara üzülüyorum. Asla o internet kafe deneyimini yaşayamıyıcaklar.

Ama oyun tabiki sadece multiplayer değil. Ne kadar en güzel kısmı o olsada tek kişilik oyuncu moduda gayet eğlenceli. Sessiz dostumuz Gordon Freeman'ın gözünden oynadığımız hikaye modunda yanlış giden bir deney sonrası farklı bir gezegen ile dünya arasında açılan geçitler sayesinde dünyanın uzaylı istalasına uğramasını anlatıyor. Tabi oyundaki tek zorluk uzaylılar değil. Oynanış yeni nesil oyuncuları biraz zorlayabilir. Çünkü yeni oyunların aksine burda şuraya git buraya git diye bir işaretçi yok. Ne yapacağınızı öğrenmek için dostlarınızı iyi dinlemeli ve ne dediklerine önem vermelisiniz aksi halde çoğu oyuncu gibi sağa sola boş boş koşup zaman kaybedersiniz. Ben dahil çoğu kişi dinlemediğimiz için aynı şeyleri yaşadık, aslında biraz da oyunun yapısıyla alakalı geliyor. Öyle bir oyun ki hani oturupta adamları dinleyesiniz gelmiyor yani.

Neyse işin özü Half-Life bence artık oyun dünyası için genel kültür öğesidir. Oynamasanız bile bilin. Ama ben oynamanızı öneririm.Zaten Valve Complete veya Half-Life Complte alarak tüm seriyi çok uygun bir fiyata edinebilirsiniz. Kaldı ki bu fiyatlar bile indirime giriyor.

Absolute classic. I remember when this came out there was really nothing like it. Instead of being dropped into the first level and seeing action within the first minute you had buildup, like the beginning of a movie. There was all these crazy set pieces and a level progression that attempted to be seamless. And after all these years it's still really cool. If you haven't played this yet give it a shot. It's one of the more important games in the industry.
